snippet: In a wide-ranging review of the jail complex, McKinsey & Company will spend at least three months at Rikers and the Correction Department’s offices.
abstract: New York City Correction Commissioner Joseph Ponte announces that city has hired management consulting firm McKinsey & Company to develop a plan of reforms; decision follows revelations about pervasive brutality by jail staff and other serious problems at Rikers Island prison complex; firm, which has little experience working with prisons, will spend at least 12 weeks at Rikers and in Correction Department’s offices.
lead_paragraph: In a wide-ranging review of the jail complex, McKinsey & Company will spend at least three months at Rikers and the Correction Department’s offices.

headline.main: New York Hires Consultant to Create Rikers Island Reform Plan
headline.print_headline: City Hires a Consulting Firm to Develop a Reform Plan for Rikers Island
